title: 2012–13 Moldovan National Division
text:
The 2012–13 <a href="Moldovan%20National%20Division">Moldovan National Division</a> (<a href="Moldovan%20language">Moldovan</a>: Divizia Naţională) is the 22nd season of top-tier <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Moldova">Moldova</a>. The competition began on 13 July 2012 and will end in May 2013.
The league comprises 12 teams, 11 from the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Moldovan%20National%20Division">2011–12 season</a> and one promoted site from <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Moldovan%20%26quot%3BA%26quot%3B%20Division">2011–12 A Division</a>. <a href="FC%20Sheriff%20Tiraspol">Sheriff Tiraspol</a> are the defending champions.
Teams.
<a href="CSCA%E2%80%93Rapid%20Chi%C5%9Fin%C4%83u">CSCA–Rapid Chişinău</a> and <a href="FC%20Costuleni">FC Costuleni</a> were originally relegated on competitive grounds at the end of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Moldovan%20National%20Division">2011–12 season</a> as they finished in the bottom two places of the league table. However, both clubs were eventually spared after <a href="FC%20Sfintul%20Gheorghe">Sfintul Gheorghe Suruceni</a> did not obtain a National Division licence for 2012–13 and only one team, runners-up <a href="FC%20Speran%C5%A3a%20Crihana%20Veche">Speranţa Crihana Veche</a>, could be promoted from the top four <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Moldovan%20%26quot%3BA%26quot%3B%20Division">2011–12 A Division</a> sides on the same grounds.
In further changes, "FC Academia UTM Chişinău" were renamed <a href="FC%20Academia%20Chi%C5%9Fin%C4%83u">FC Academia Chişinău</a>.
Personnel and sponsorship.
Promoted sides Speranţa Crihana Veche play their home matches in the nearby town of <a href="Cahul">Cahul</a>.
League table.
<onlyinclude></onlyinclude>
Positions by round.
The following table represents the teams position after each round in the competition.
Results.
The schedule consists of three rounds. During the first two rounds, each team plays each other once home and away for a total of 22 matches. The pairings of the third round will then be set according to the standings after the first two rounds, giving every team a third game against each opponent for a total of 33 games per team.
